newsitem.title: BELGIUM: W. Europe pulp/paper/board output may rise in 1997.
newsitem.headline: W. Europe pulp/paper/board output may rise in 1997.

text.p: Western Europe's total output of paper and board as well as of pulp may rise this year compared with 1996, the Confederation of European Paper Industries (CEPI) said on Tuesday.
CEPI, issuing regular production figures, said total paper and board output jumped 10.6 percent to 18.5 million tonnes in the fourth quarter last year compared with the same 1995 quarter.
Total pulp output also increased in the fourth quarter, up by 7.3 percent to 8.3 million tonnes.
However, due to a weak start to the year, total paper and board output still fell 0.8 percent last year compared with 1995.
Pulp output also declined in 1996, down by 5.4 percent.
Looking ahead, CEPI said it did not expect any dramatic changes for paper and board production this year.

Most graphic grades would show a strong increase during the first half and a slowdown towards the end of the year, sanitary and household might continue with a slight increase and packaging grades might grow marginally, it said.
"Altogether, 1997 could show a surplus over 1996 of between 1 to 2 percent," CEPI said in a report.
Turning to the outlook for pulp in 1997, CEPI said:
"...good 4th quarter results and at least slight growth expectation for paper production in 1997 leads to the assumption that 1997 total pulp production might exceed the 1996 results."
